page.title: 01POPULATION
page.content: Clyst Hydon is in East Devon.It is about five miles from the small town of Cullompton and around ten miles from the city of Exeter.The road B3176 runs through it.Clyst Hydon village dominates our square 03.01,which is where we are.It is the biggest built up area in our grid.Clyst Hydon had a population of 262 in 1981 but we don't know what it is now in 1985 because there is only a census every number of years.The major land cover is grassland pasture.As you come through the village you will see a varied number of houses,thatched cottages, modern houses, manors, victorian houses, a pub, a swimming pool, a play group and a village hall.The village also has a church.The Huyshe family used to own the village and a lot of land around it.The parish is set in the Culm Valley and surrounded by
